name: haiberdyn-agentic-terminal-tools
description: Enables agentic terminal access across every profile (WSL, PowerShell, Git Bash, Ubuntu, cmd) without VS Code gatekeeping.
author: HaiberDyn

languageModelTools.name: haiberdyn_open_terminal_profile
languageModelTools.userDescription: Opens a terminal using a VS Code terminal profile. First call haiberdyn_list_terminal_profiles and pass one of the exact names it returns (case-sensitive). This guarantees the profile name exists before executing the command.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Opens a terminal using a VS Code terminal profile (e.g., 'WSL', 'Git Bash', 'PowerShell'). Always call haiberdyn_list_terminal_profiles before this tool and supply one of those exact profileName results to ensure the command returns the terminal instance.

profileName.description: Name of VS Code terminal profile to launch (case-sensitive)

comment.description: Optional comment describing the terminal's purpose

languageModelTools.name: haiberdyn_list_terminal_profiles
languageModelTools.userDescription: Lists configured VS Code terminal profiles across each platform.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Returns the known terminal profile names, paths, and args from VS Code settings so agents can open the right shell.

languageModelTools.name: haiberdyn_list_managed_terminals
languageModelTools.userDescription: Lists active terminals in the HaiberDyn pool, including IDs and comments.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Shows every managed terminal's ID, shell, comment, and last-used timestamp so agents can reuse them safely.

languageModelTools.name: haiberdyn_execute_in_terminal
languageModelTools.userDescription: Execute commands in a tracked terminal (use the terminal_id returned by haiberdyn_open_terminal_profile). This tool does not create terminalsâ€”it writes into an existing terminal managed by the pool.
languageModelTools.modelDescription: Execute commands in a tracked terminal (identified via terminal_id from haiberdyn_open_terminal_profile). The tool requires an existing terminal_id and does not create new shells.

command.description: The command to execute in the terminal

shell_type.description: Optional shell hint (for logging) when executing a command in an existing terminal

working_dir.description: Optional working directory for command execution

show_terminal.description: Whether to show the terminal in the UI (default: true)

terminal_id.description: ID of a previously opened terminal to reuse

comment.description: Optional comment describing the terminal's purpose
